author: Bettina Menzel
title: Minijob-System wird geändert: Millionen Beschäftigte erhalten Lohnplus
text:
Minijob-System wird geändert: Millionen Beschäftigte erhalten Lohnplus
Ab 2026 dürfen Minijobber mehr verdienen – und behalten trotzdem mehr vom Lohn. Wer allerdings nicht mitrechnet, landet schnell in der Beitragspflicht.
Berlin – Minijobber in Deutschland haben ab dem 1. Januar 2026 mehr Geld in der Tasche: Der gesetzliche Mindestlohn steigt auf 13,90 Euro pro Stunde. Die monatliche Verdienstgrenze für Minijobber erhöht sich entsprechend der dynamischen Kopplung an den Mindestlohn von derzeit 556 Euro auf voraussichtlich 603 Euro im Jahr 2026.
Wer also einen Minijob mit konstantem Stundenumfang hat, kann künftig mehr verdienen, ohne den Minijob-Status zu verlieren und in die Sozialversicherung zu rutschen. Für bestimmte Branchen gelten hingegen eigene Mindestlöhne aus Tarifverträgen, wie das Fachportal Minijob-Zentrale mitteilt. Das ist etwa im Gebäudereinigungsgewerbe, der Pflegebranche oder dem Elektrohandwerk der Fall.
Die maximale Arbeitszeit pro Monat bleibt weiterhin bei rund 43 Stunden. „Die Anhebung von Mindestlohn und Verdienstgrenze bei Minijobs bringt 2026 echten Mehrwert – vor allem für soziale Gruppen, die bisher am Existenzminimum gearbeitet haben“, kommentiert der Verein „Für soziales Leben“ die Änderungen. Die Experten mahnen jedoch: Nur wer sich über die Regelungen informiert und sauber abrechne, profitiere am Ende wirklich.
6,9 Millionen Minijobber profitieren: Ab 2027 erhöht sich die Verdienstgrenze nochmals
Rund 6,9 Millionen Minijobber gibt es in Deutschland. Ein Großteil von ihnen sind Frauen. Laut Daten der Bundesagentur für Arbeit leisteten Frauen im Jahr 2023 durchschnittlich 24 Prozent weniger Stunden Erwerbsarbeit als Männer. Viele arbeiten auch in Teilzeit. Es sei eine bessere Kinderbetreuung in Deutschland nötig, um diesen Trend zu stoppen, kommentierte der Chef des ifo-Instituts, Clemens Fuest.
Ab 1. Januar 2027 wird der Mindestlohn nochmals angehoben und steigt auf 14,60 Euro pro Stunde. Die Verdienstgrenze liegt dann voraussichtlich bei 633 Euro. Mehr Netto im Minijob stärkt auch die Binnennachfrage, wenn auch nur in geringem Ausmaß. Die deutsche Wirtschaft schrumpfte zuletzt zwei Jahre in Folge. Für 2025 sahen Experten wie etwa das Kieler Institut für Weltwirtschaft (IfW) zuletzt ein leichtes Wachstum voraus.

author: Clint Chan Tack
title: Scotiabank reports $678m profit
text:
News
Scotiabank reports $678m profit
Clint Chan Tack
SCOTIABANK has reported an after tax profit of $678 million for the year ended October 31, 2023.
This information is contained in a statement issued by the bank on December 28.
The bank said this figure represented a decrease of one per cent from the prior year ended October 31, 2022.
General manager Gayle Pazos said, “I am pleased to report that Scotiabank has once again delivered another year of solid financial results. This is the second successive year that we have posted net income before tax of over $1 billion, following a record breaking performance in 2022."
She added that the bank's performance this year was supported by "$1.3 billion or seven per cent loan growth across our core business lines."
Pazos said, "Our strong profitability year over year is a testament to the confidence that our customers have placed in us, as well as the hard work and dedication of our team."
She also said the bank continues to work on digital initiatives to address customers' changing needs.
"Digital adoption increased to 54% with 75% of total retail customers enrolled on online banking."
The bank's total assets at the end of October stood at $29.7 billion.

author: Joselyn King
title: Local Clergy Offer Community Message Of Healing Following Flood
text:
Local Clergy Offer Community Message Of Healing Following Flood
TRIADELPHIA – Nine local clergy representing a variety of faiths provided a united message of healing during an interfaith service Wednesday in honor of those affected by tragic flooding in Ohio County last month.
The service took place outside on Liberty Distributors’ property in Triadelphia. The business was among the many devastated by the flash flooding that devastated Valley Grove and Triadelphia, as well as parts of Elm Grove and Woodsdale.
Rabbi Joshua Lief of the Temple Shalom commended those who have stepped forward to assist during the flood aftermath, and he offered stern words for those who have not.
“To those who have not helped, to those who have delayed the act of helping – I say it is immoral to stand idly by while your neighbor bleeds …,” he said.
“To those who are still suffering, I say you are not alone. For all of us together are one community bound together as partners with God. Responsible for each other, we will continue to stand together. ”
Pastor Michael Palmer of the Triadelphia United Methodist Church spoke a prayer for the nine people who lost their lives in the flooding, and those who continue to mourn.
“I speak only their first names, because Heavenly Father you are their last,” Palmer said. He asked the Lord to uphold their families and friends in comfort.
The Rev. Kenneth Hardway of the First Christian Church prayed for those who lost homes, possessions and livelihood during the flood.
“The grief is natural and healthy, but it will not define us,” he explained. “We can lift up our heads today knowing the value of life, feeling the solidarity of community and experiencing the hope of a new day.”
The Rev. Adam Mick of Christ Community Church spoke for the spiritual health of first responders and emergency personnel.
“May they know that their sacrificial service reflects love for this community,” he said. “God grant them rest – rest that so many have yet to take. (Give them) rest for their weariness, and a killing for any pain either seen or unseen.”
The efforts of neighbors, volunteers, and relief workers were addressed by The Most Rev. Mark Brennan, Bishop of the Catholic Diocese of Wheeling-Charleston.
“Those who have survived the flood waters, and those who are helping them, need to have the confidence that with the strength of God working through them, they can accomplish much good to help people rebuild their lives, their homes, their businesses,” Brennan said.
Bishop Darrell Cummings of the Bethlehem Apostolic Temple spoke of despair in the wake of the flood.
“As bad as it was – and it was horrible and sad and I wish it wouldn’t have happened – I just want to remind us that it could have been worse,” he said. “All we have to do is ask the people in Texas.
“Where we have lost nine people, that is devastating. They have lost hundreds, and they are still looking for 190 people.”
The Ven. Joshua Saxe of St. Matthews Episcopal Church offered prayer for the restoration of the community, its infrastructure and beauty.
“The breath of God redeems and repairs what is broken,” he said. “We don’t do this alone. It is God working through us, and through the hands of those serving our neighbors in need that will see our community raised back up. Let us continue to lean on God, and continue to lean on each other in the coming days and months ahead.”
The Rev. Joe Hill, the new pastor at Christ United Methodist Church, offered a prayer for government officials to remain focused on fair and just treatment for all who seek assistance.
“We are grateful for our leaders who understand that the office they hold is not a privilege. They are not so much put in charge of others, but the well being of others is entrusted to their care,” he said. “In their promotion of such ways, we are grateful.”

author: 编辑：刘香云
title: 精准锁定故障源 解决"顽疾"-资讯-内蒙古新闻网
text:
“我家最近频繁跳闸，找了几次电工都没解决，你们快来帮帮我吧！”近日，内蒙古电力集团巴彦淖尔临河供电公司接到了一通紧急报修电话。
为尽快恢复用户正常用电，公司客户经理迅速响应。在了解基本情况后，立即对电表、用电线路和设备进行仔细排查，重点检测漏电保护器灵敏度，并检查接线端子是否松动。最终，成功锁定故障源头——一条老化线路表皮破损导致间歇性漏电，引发频繁跳闸。经过半小时紧急抢修，客户经理协助用户更换问题线路，彻底消除了用电隐患。
为满足客户多元化用电服务需求，公司深化客户经理职责，通过客户群体细分和服务措施精准落实，推动服务模式从“被动响应”向“主动感知”转变，前移服务关口。为客户量身定制差异化、个性化服务方案，提供包括预约上门、帮办代办、能效分析、线路“问诊”等在内的专属服务。同时，密切监测客户用电量变化，常态化、制度化开展用电安全隐患排查治理，筑牢安全防线。 通过强化客户经理体系建设，优化“三制三送两督导”服务机制，公司将供电服务精准触达客户，让客户享受便捷高效的专属服务体验。
下一步，临河供电公司将持续推动供电保障由“用上电”向“用好电”升级，深化“获得电力”服务内涵，优化供用电营商环境，切实让客户在用电过程中感知服务新变化、体验优质新服务、获得可靠新保障。（袁易利）
